modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses heavily on the 'Savoir' (understanding the gravity of sin) to trigger 'Devoir' (the obligation to shun it). The 'Pouvoir' (power to resist) is largely absent or presented as lost in the act of sin.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Fornication) to ~S2 (Sins of weakness) to S1 (Union with God).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by defining 'fornication' broadly as any attachment to the world, making the only escape a total 'attachment to God'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a total loss of agency and 'animality'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses high-gravity language regarding sin and mentions grace, the actantial subject is almost always the human soul struggling to 'attach itself' or 'shun' evil. God is the Object of desire and the Sender of the law, but rarely the active Subject of the rescue.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Provided these other sins spring, not from concupiscence... they can rightly be considered as being outside the body.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Human as primary actor in sanctification
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: he wants us... to preserve it in inviolable purity

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: body purchased so dearly at the cost of Christ’s adorable blood

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon focuses on the 'Sinner' as a generic type rather than using David or other biblical figures as models.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Fear and vigilance; a sense of the fragility of one's own soul against the 'mire' of passion.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is a human performance supported by divine enlightenment.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the specific sin of fornication to the general 'love of the world' is logically consistent but shifts the goalposts for the hearer.
spanning_punten: The soul is 'incapable' of thinking (no Pouvoir), yet is commanded to 'shun' (Devoir).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: anyone who is united to the Lord becomes one spirit with him

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'temple' status, but the human must 'preserve' it.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an enslaving force that destroys human rationality.

eschatologie.actant_van_voltooiing: Man (must preserve the purity until the judgment seat).

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a 'Warning Narrative' where the Hearer is the Subject tasked with avoiding a powerful Opponent (Flesh) to reach the Object (God). God acts as the Sender (Law) and the Price-Payer (Past), but is not the current active Subject of the soul's preservation.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The soul is the subject of 'preserving' and 'shunning'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make the Holy Spirit the Subject who guards the temple He has claimed.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'He wants us to preserve it,' use 'The Holy Spirit, who has claimed you, will not let His temple be easily surrendered.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the hero/victim of their own willpower.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'bought at a price' aspect as an ongoing act of Christ's ownership.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' to see God even when the flesh is loud.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (concupiscence) is already very intense.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The gravity of sin is well-established.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The secondary program (Ethics/Shunning) overshadows the primary (Soteriology/Union).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Union with God (Program 1) must be the power source for Shunning (Program 2).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is a masterpiece of psychological insight into the nature of addiction and sin, but it risks leaving the hearer in a state of 'Devoir' without the 'Pouvoir' of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on Augustine's use of antithesis; Greimas reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is the soul's own effort to remain 'un-glued' from the world.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Greek 'porneia'; semiotics shows how the 'Body' actant functions as both a scene and a victim.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights the 'Subject-switch' that occurs when the sinner becomes 'mere flesh'—the human subject is deleted by the opponent.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Grace' as a modal helper for the preacher's intellect rather than the sinner's liberation.
